narrative.title: Scene 15-2 — Entering Lamunda’s Pavilion
paragraphs: The stuffies slipped inside a dimly lit pavilion where a polished black orb rested on a small table. Lamunda observed them quietly at first, then exclaimed in surprise as they approached. She invited them to sit and listened closely, ready to share whatever guidance they needed.

vocabulary.definition: In a way that is not bright; with low light.
examples: The room was dimly lit by a small lamp.
Shapes moved dimly in the fog.

vocabulary.definition: Provided with light or made bright.
examples: The hallway was lit by flickering candles.
The stage lit up as the show began.

vocabulary.definition: Made smooth and shiny by rubbing.
examples: She polished the wooden table until it gleamed.
The polished stone reflected the sunlight.

vocabulary.definition: Watched something carefully or noticed it.
examples: The scientist observed the ants crawling in a line.
She observed that the door had been left open.

vocabulary.definition: Spoke suddenly and loudly because of surprise or excitement.
examples: “Wow!” he exclaimed when he saw the huge painting.
She exclaimed in joy when the package arrived.

vocabulary.definition: Moved quietly or quickly, often so as not to be noticed.
examples: He slipped out of the room without anyone seeing him.
They slipped through the door just before it closed.

events.text: The stuffies enter a dimly lit pavilion.
A polished black orb sits on the small round table.
Lamunda observed their arrival with interest.
She exclaimed when they approached, noting they were far from home.
She invites them to sit and ask what they wish to know.

distractors: Lamunda hides behind a curtain and refuses to speak to them.
The pavilion is brightly lit by dozens of lanterns.
A group of crawlies guard the entrance to Lamunda’s tent.
